Agu.Action: Carries a TV on his head with a warm smile and clever eyes, scouts children for football talent, and tries to charm the village constable.
Balances a television on his head while scouting children for football talent, showing physical skill and leadership.
Attempts to charm the village constable with the non-functional TV, demonstrating social intelligence and confidence.
Has the young recruits perform imaginative 'TV' shows despite discouragement, showing optimism toward peace observers.
Negotiates food and cash fairly with the 2nd Lieutenant and shares cash with Dike and recruits.
Engages in playful argument with Dike while walking home.
Uses imagination creatively to entertain recruits despite lack of actual TV channels.
Negotiates successfully with the 2nd Lieutenant to exchange performance for food and money.
Remains optimistic and undiscouraged after the Village Constable dismisses his 'imagination TV'.
Does not greet the old witch woman who is feared by others, but internally asserts he is a good boy.
Counts the money charged from the bush taxi after blocking the road with a tree limb, participating in an act of extortion.
Hangs from a tree and helps saw a large branch to block the road, then confidently charges a bush taxi a 'tax'.
Responds calmly and confidently to the old witch woman's accusations, denying trouble will follow him.
Lays on his mother's back reading aloud, looks up at his father happily, comfortable and safe.
Sits behind his mother preparing dinner while humming a song, enjoys watching her work.
Mother quizzes him on ingredients, little sister mimics him.
Responds incorrectly to father's question about lions' habitat, showing lack of knowledge.
Reads out loud from a nature magazine, showing engagement and willingness to learn.
Works hard helping his mother prepare dinner and pays attention to her instructions.
Barely stays awake in class, indicating inattentiveness or lack of focus.
Notices refugees walking towards the village, finds them fascinating.
Pees a warm spray on Big Brother while he is bathing, provoking him.
Yells at Big Brother to be let go when rolled up in a carpet.
Attends church every Sunday with his family despite discomfort.
Notices refugees walking towards the village and finds them fascinating.
Pees on Big Brother while he is bathing, provoking a reaction.
Yells at Big Brother to be let go when captured and immobilized in a carpet.
Attends church regularly with his family despite discomfort and distraction.
Laughs with Big Brother at Father's scolding, showing shared amusement and lightheartedness.
Quietly admits to getting food from Nigerians when confronted by Father, showing some honesty but hesitation.
Understands Father's sarcasm about the Reverend Doctorate and interprets it with some wit.
Laughs along with Big Brother at Father's frustration, showing social awareness and confidence.
Is caught with plastic containers of food from Nigerians and struggles to explain himself clearly to Father.
Obeys Father and agrees to return the items despite wanting to keep them.
Makes funny poses and tries to engage his unresponsive Grandfather by doing 'the robot' and tickling his nostrils.
Acknowledges Father's authority and agrees to return the items without argument.
Earns something (implied effort) but is stopped before completing his point.
Helps Mother with chores (grating root), showing responsibility and contribution to family.
Attempts to engage Grandfather with playful behavior despite Grandfather's unresponsiveness.
Tickles Grandfather's nostrils with a reed, causing him to twitch but not stop Agu.
Laughs to himself after tickling Grandfather.
Hides the straw behind his back when caught by Father, who reassures him not to worry.
Responds to Big Brother's comment about luck by saying he is not lucky but liked by everyone.
Notices the teenage girl Big Brother likes and pumps water harder, then laughs with Big Brother.
Realizes he is caught by his father but cleverly hides the straw behind his back, showing awareness and quick thinking.
Engages in playful behavior by tickling Grandfather's nostrils, showing confidence and social ease.
Laughs at Big Brother's comment and pumps water harder to impress a girl, demonstrating social awareness and confidence.
Does not show any signs of distress or confusion when the radio is turned off abruptly, indicating emotional composure.
Feeds his Grandfather during the meal, showing care and attentiveness.
Laughs heartily with family after burping and when Sister farts, sharing a moment of joy and closeness.
Feeds his Grandfather patiently and mimics his father's slow, appreciative way of eating to improve his own behavior.
Burps involuntarily and laughs uncontrollably during the meal, showing lack of self-control.
Sleeps outside to avoid being beaten inside the house.
Watches his parents with concern and waits for an answer about whether he will be beaten.
Sells the family TV, indicating resourcefulness or taking initiative under pressure.
Sleeps outside to avoid beatings, showing awareness and self-preservation.
Waits for an answer from his parents about whether he will be beaten, showing hesitance and lack of confidence.
Hides his face from the light when woken up, indicating grogginess and reluctance to face the day.
Big Brother sees Agu struggling below and picks him up and puts him on his shoulders so he can see. Agu whispers to his brother.
Agu smiles to himself, the Pastor looks desperate to him.
Agu looks down at his Father to share his observation, but his father has a look that Agu has never seen before: fear.
Looks up at the fans but notices they are not turning, showing awareness of his environment despite being a child.
Whispers to his brother asking 'Where is Dike?,' indicating concern and situational awareness.
Smiles to himself while the Pastor looks desperate, showing a moment of internal confidence or insight.
Looks down at his father and notices fear he has never seen before, demonstrating emotional intelligence and observation skills.
Pleadingly asks his father about Dike's whereabouts, showing concern for family.
Listens quietly with Big Brother to parents' argument, playing a game to distract themselves.
Pleadingly asks his father about the whereabouts of Dike, showing concern and initiative to seek information.
Listens through the wall with Big Brother to his parents' argument, engaging in a quiet, observant behavior rather than intervening.
Insults the driver when called a 'little boy', asserting his maturity.
Insists he is not a 'little' boy when the driver refers to him as such, showing confidence and self-awareness.
Does not intervene further when the driver refuses to give them space, relying on Father to negotiate, showing limited agency in this situation.
Cries and calls out to Mother when she is taken away, showing emotional openness and attachment.
Cries and tries to move toward Mother but is held back by Father.
Breaks away and runs after the car, crying after his mother.
Eats quietly with family despite disliking father's cooking.
Breaks away and runs after the car, crying after his mother.
Accepts Big Brother holding his hand and being led away.
Sits quietly and eats the meager meal despite disliking the taste.
Runs with family to find safety under heavy gunfire, stays close to family and follows their lead.
Internally feels disconnected from his body, indicating shock or paralysis in a dangerous situation.
Asks his father if they will be killed, showing vulnerability and seeking reassurance.
Asks his father if they will be killed, showing awareness of danger and seeking information.
Turns towards his father instead of panicking or joining the fearful whispering men.
Shows dread and fear as bullets hit and explosions rock the room.
Shaking, eyes tearing, stomach churning with fear and nausea when confronted with danger.
Observes surroundings carefully, notices that some NRC soldiers are children just a few years older than himself.
Looks angrily at the old woman who denies knowing the men.
Reaches for his Big Brother's body despite danger, showing attachment and concern.
Dodges bullets and runs to escape execution.
Freezes momentarily when seeing his Big Brother shot, almost getting shot himself.
Cries drunkenly, mournful sobs while alone in the forest, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Throws pot of rice in frustration but immediately regrets it and checks for leftover rice, showing remorse and care.
Wanders lost, confused, angry, overwhelmed by emotions, indicating internal struggle but no hostile behavior toward others.
Follows a boy he perceives as a forest spirit, showing curiosity and a non-threatening approach.
Finds grains of rice in an abandoned hunting lodge and attempts to cook them by putting them in a pot with water.
Cannot start a fire to cook the rice, throws the pot in frustration, then immediately regrets it and checks if any rice is left.
Eats rotten fruit found in the forest to stave off hunger.
Drinks water from a creek to quench thirst.
Tries to sleep on a tree branch despite being emotionally overwhelmed and crying.
Wanders aimlessly, lost, confused, and angry, crying drunkenly and showing emotional overwhelm.
Tries eating grass out of desperation.
Follows the boy into the forest despite fear and danger.
Cries and screams when attacked, shows vulnerability and does not retaliate aggressively.
Bends down into tall grass, watches and listens carefully when sensing danger in the forest.
Freezes in fear and curls up crying after being attacked by the boy, unable to defend himself.
Is hypnotized and in awe of the NDF soldiers' presence, showing a moment of vulnerability and lack of control.
Is quickly subdued, tied up, and taunted by the soldiers, indicating a lack of immediate defensive or evasive skill.
Avoids looking at Strika as he passes him again.
Avoids looking at Strika as he passes him again.
Raises his open hands when asked to show his fingers, indicating openness and non-aggression.
Nods shyly when asked about his origin, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Expresses fear and sadness about his father and the violence he is fleeing from.
Raises his open hands when commanded, showing compliance and awareness of the situation.
Nods shyly when asked about his origin, indicating cautious communication under pressure.
Cannot form words when asked about his father, showing emotional overwhelm and difficulty articulating under stress.
Hides in the bush and runs away from danger as instructed by his father, demonstrating survival instinct but limited agency.
Nods yes to Commandant's questions, tries to hold back tears, drinks water given to him, shows vulnerability and obedience.
Looks back and forth between Commandant and Two-I-C, unsure what to say.
Bites his lips and tries to hold back tears when asked about hunger and thirst, showing emotional restraint under pressure.
Responds quietly but correctly to Commandant's questions, showing awareness and compliance.
Looks back and forth between Commandant and Two-I-C, not knowing what to say, indicating uncertainty or hesitation.
Nods and verbally affirms his willingness to become a warrior and fight, showing acceptance and readiness to follow orders.
Keeps pace and carries heavy ammunition despite struggling under the weight.
Concentrates on moving carefully through wet underbrush, wary of dangerous animals.
Stares in hypnotic wonder at the helicopter instead of immediately taking cover.
Dumps ammunition and efficiently distributes water to soldiers when prompted by Rambo.
Startled by the booming sound from the Commandant's baton, showing momentary distraction.
Is handed over by Commandant to Two-I-C for training and deployment, indicating trust in his potential.
Is ignored initially by Two-I-C who is busy with civilian porters, showing Agu's low immediate priority or lack of assertiveness.
Competes with a dog for scraps of food after being ignored and having no bowl.
Responds to being chastised by sarcastically asking 'Which one of you is the dog?'
Uses his hands to gather leftover food scraps and competes with a dog for food despite being chastised and pushed away.
Responds defiantly to the cook's insult by asking 'Which one of you is the dog?'
Carries ammunition and water all day, showing willingness to contribute to the group.
Listens attentively to Commandant and other soldiers, showing awareness of the situation and the morale of the group.
Expresses uncertainty about seeing his mother again, indicating emotional vulnerability and possible lack of confidence.
Follows instructions on stance adjustment from Griot and Rambo, showing willingness to learn and adapt.
Is perplexed by Two-I-C's explanations, showing confusion and lack of understanding.
Is swept away with Commandant, enjoys the spectacle and reactions from other soldiers.
Is perplexed by Two-I-C's explanations, the politics are beyond his understanding.
Is swept away with Commandant, enjoys the spectacle and reactions from other soldiers.
Watches in horror as an initiate is quickly dispatched after falling from a blow to the head.
Endures a brutal gauntlet of sticks, branches, and clubs without showing aggression or retaliation.
Endures a brutal initiation gauntlet, taking heavy hits without giving up.
Watches in horror as a fellow initiate is killed, showing emotional reaction but no immediate action.
Raises his fist in the air, swept by the energy and fire of Commandant's speech.
Voraciously eating the ball of mashed rice given by the Chief Priest during the ceremony.
Gathers supplies from the camp under Commandant's supervision, preparing for continued conflict.
Raises his fist in the air, swept by the energy and fire of Commandant's speech.
Undergoes the initiation ritual with the Chief Priest, showing acceptance and endurance.
Voraciously eats the ball of mashed rice given by the Chief Priest, demonstrating obedience and focus.
Gathers supplies from the camp structures under Commandant's supervision.
Smells the small portion of food given and quickly stows it in his bag without sharing.
Sticks with Preacher, following him wherever he goes, showing loyalty and companionship.
Asks what zero-zero-one means, showing curiosity and willingness to learn.
Smells the garri given and quickly stows it in his backpack without eating immediately, showing prudence and foresight.
Sticks with Preacher and follows him wherever he goes, indicating reliance on more experienced individuals and a cautious approach.
Identifies the Iroko tree and names other trees as children of the forest, demonstrating some knowledge of his environment.
Nods anxiously and salutes the Commandant, showing respect and willingness to follow orders.
Listens quietly and thoughtfully to the Commandant's harsh lessons about killing and survival.
Nods and listens attentively to the Commandant's instructions about killing and survival.
Shakes his head when asked if he has killed before, showing honesty and self-awareness about his inexperience.
Salutes the Commandant with delayed realization, indicating some hesitation or lack of immediate confidence.
Nods anxiously but with pride when told to destroy threats, showing a mix of nervousness and willingness to act.
Accepts fruit offered by Strika and shares it, showing gratitude despite nervousness.
Looks away when noticed by Strika, indicating discomfort or avoidance.
Shares fruit offered by Strika, accepts the gesture despite nervousness.
Watches the soldiers' coordinated movement with fascination but follows Preacher's direction to stay on task.
Runs with his Small Boy Unit past Commandant's position, maintaining formation and discipline.
Looks back after ambush deployment, showing awareness of surroundings.
Whispers gently to Strika, asks personal questions about war, killing, fear, and family, showing concern and interest.
Shares the root that Strika is chewing to soothe his belly, accepting the gesture of sharing.
Asks Strika if he is stupid, provoking a hostile reaction.
Whispers questions to Strika to understand his feelings about war, killing, fear, and command, showing curiosity and social awareness.
Tries the root that Strika is chewing to understand its effect, showing willingness to learn and adapt.
Tries the 'morale booster' substance despite its nauseating taste, showing resilience and openness to new experiences.
Asks Strika if he is stupid, provoking a negative reaction and showing a lack of social tact.
Notices the boys lowering themselves into the bushes and follows the order to stay low, showing awareness and attentiveness to the situation.
Tries to beat away mosquitoes despite the tense situation, indicating some distraction or discomfort.
Turns slowly when feeling breathing on his neck, showing caution and alertness.
Focuses down the road as signaled by Strika, demonstrating ability to follow tactical instructions.
Internally experiences fear and physical discomfort but remains focused on what is going to happen, showing mental resilience.
Grips his machete harder, looks around petrified, confused, excited during ambush.
Forgets the extra ammunition, scrambles back down into the ditch.
Forgets the extra ammunition and scrambles back down into the ditch during an ambush.
Grips his machete harder and reacts quickly by ducking when gunfire erupts.
Feels petrified, confused, and excited, showing emotional overwhelm in a critical moment.
Looks disdainfully at the trembling Corporal who killed his father, shaking his head at him.
Is ordered by Commandant to kill the Corporal, but no explicit action of killing is described here.
Looks disdainfully at the trembling Corporal and shakes his head, showing controlled emotional response and awareness of the situation.
Does not react impulsively to the Corporal's pleas or the chaos around, maintaining composure despite nerves firing off.
Fails to immediately act on the Commandant's order to kill the Corporal, showing hesitation or internal conflict.
Looks back lost when discussed as possibly weak to wield a cutlass, grips his machete harder when reminded of his father's murderers.
Looks back lost when questioned about his strength and weapon choice.
Grips his machete harder when commanded to kill, showing readiness and resolve.
Reluctantly kills the corporal under Commandant's pressure, feels sick and vomits afterward.
Participates in brutal violence encouraged by Commandant and Strika, joins in celebration of killing.
Follows Commandant's instructions to kill the corporal, uses physical strength and anger to carry out the act effectively.
Feels sick and vomits after the killing, showing emotional overwhelm and possible lack of psychological readiness.
Feels deep remorse and internal conflict after killing a man, acknowledging it as a bad sin but believing it is the right thing to do.
Shares found cigarettes with Strika while searching through looted vehicles.
Kills a man and feels conflicted but understands it is necessary.
Finds cigarettes under a seat and shows them to Strika, demonstrating alertness and resourcefulness.
Receives a high-quality rifle from the Commandant and is entrusted as Special Guard, indicating trust in his capability.
Mimics Strika's salute, showing willingness to conform and learn military discipline.
Looks up to thank Strika after receiving clothes, showing appreciation.
Plays with Strika, showing a rare glimpse of childish fun and camaraderie.
Sits down with his rifle, looking at it proudly and reflects on the importance of keeping it safe.
Tries on far too large army pants and ammunition vest using a piece of hemp as a belt, showing resourcefulness despite ill-fitting gear.
Mimics Strika's salute and tries to show confidence as a new Special Guard.
Plays and shows childish fun with Strika while on duty, indicating moments of distraction or immaturity.
Watches the sky apprehensively with comrades, sharing their tension and relief when danger passes.
Salivates along with others at the fire, showing shared hunger and camaraderie.
Watches the sky apprehensively and remains still with others while a helicopter with rocket launchers passes nearby, showing awareness and caution.
Breathes a sigh of relief only after the helicopter sound fades, indicating patience and situational awareness.
Notices the smashed bullet at his feet and bends over to pick it up despite ongoing gunfire.
Does not react with visible fear or panic to bullets zipping past him and ricocheting off the wall.
Obeys Commandant's call to come and look through the scope, follows orders without hesitation.
Is selected by Commandant to fight alongside him, showing willingness to engage in battle.
Obeys Commandant's call promptly and looks through the special scope, demonstrating attentiveness and willingness to learn new skills.
Is selected by Commandant among the volunteers who show heart and readiness to fight, indicating recognition of his capability and confidence.
Shakes head to show no fear when asked by Commandant, despite feeling afraid inside.
Shakes his head to show he is not afraid when asked by the Commandant, despite feeling fear inside.
Is pulled up by the Commandant as an example to others, indicating he is seen as capable or confident.
Follows others into battle despite astonishment, seeks approval from Commandant and Strika after firing.
Fires rifle with safety on, fails to shoot initially.
Follows Commandant's instruction, takes safety off and fires successfully.
Keeps moving forward with the group despite astonishment, showing adaptability and confidence.
Kicks a wooden RPG prop, showing curiosity and engagement with surroundings.
Searches pockets of a dead body for supplies and gold nuggets, bites one out of curiosity.
Calls Strika to show him the gold, despite Strika's wary reaction.
Searches dead bodies quickly and efficiently, taking useful supplies and loot.
Notices that some RPGs are made of wood and tests one by kicking it.
Curiously bites a gold nugget without understanding its value or significance.
Shows the gold to Strika despite Strika's wary reaction, indicating possible lack of judgment.
Places the wad with gold nuggets on Commandant's table and waits obediently, showing respect and trust.
Thanks Commandant sincerely for praise after fighting bravely.
Eagerly sniffs brown-brown to follow Commandant's lead despite never having done it before.
Places the wad with gold nuggets on Commandant's table carefully and waits obediently, showing respect and awareness of hierarchy.
Coughs to call attention to himself politely during Commandant's strategic discussion.
Careful not to step on maps spread on the floor, showing awareness and respect for important materials.
Sniffs brown-brown eagerly despite never having experienced it before, indicating naivety and lack of self-control.
Responds to Commandant's question about leading by saying he is happy to be following, showing humility but possibly lack of ambition or confidence in leadership.
Expresses willingness to follow the Commandant and acknowledges his leadership.
Nods respectfully and keeps emotions about his mother private to avoid showing vulnerability.
Agrees to keep the Commandant's secret and shows pleasure in being trusted.
Acknowledges the Commandant's leadership and expresses willingness to follow orders.
Nods and listens attentively when the Commandant explains the strategic importance of a location on the map.
Keeps his emotions in check and does not show vulnerability in front of the Commandant.
Agrees to keep the Commandant's help a secret, showing discretion and trustworthiness.
Keeps Commandant's secret as requested, showing trust and obedience.
Collapses into Strika crying and is comforted, showing vulnerability and seeking connection.
Complies with Commandant's abusive and coercive command out of fear.
Keeps the Commandant's secret as instructed, showing obedience and discretion.
Kneels respectfully in front of the Commandant, following orders promptly.
Complies with the Commandant's abusive command out of fear, showing lack of agency and confidence.
Attempts to move quietly despite physical pain, showing effort and some skill in stealth.
Collapses and cries in pain, showing vulnerability and emotional distress.
Considers Strika his only friend despite Strika's rough appearance.
Feels special under Commandant's gaze despite the violent context.
Cannot make eye contact with Commandant during the war prayer.
Hobbles in pain but still prepares for battle, allowing a comrade to treat his wound and continue fighting.
Cannot make eye contact with the Commandant during a critical moment of motivation and leadership.
Looks curiously at a white woman passenger and notices fear in her face, which angers him even though he doesn't understand why.
Yells and taunts the UN convoy with rifles pointed into the air.
Looks curiously and intently at the white woman in the UN convoy, noticing her fear and feeling anger despite not understanding why.
Adjusts to the drug-induced high while preparing for the attack, showing some level of mental adaptation.
Follows orders and moves with the NDF soldiers silently through the jungle and farming plots, preparing for an attack.
Prays for guidance, saying 'God, help me to be doing the thing I am supposed to be doing.'
Passes by village mosque in drunken reverence, showing some respect.
Fires at targets and participates in violent combat alongside soldiers.
Breaks stare at Santa Claus painting to follow Preacher's orders.
Looks for ammunition and drugs, including cocaine, showing self-interest and survival focus.
Follows Preacher's orders promptly after breaking his stare at Santa Claus painting.
Points towards the radio tower while riding atop the AA Technical, directing attention and action.
Kneels down to search for ammunition and drugs, showing resourcefulness in a combat situation.
Appears drugged and with a lax neck, indicating impaired physical and mental state.
Momentarily distracted by the painting of Santa Claus, breaking focus.
Notices three boys crying and asks what is wrong with them, showing concern.
Calls the crying boys over and leads them down the street, taking responsibility for their well-being.
Looks around unsure how he got there, appears drugged and confused.
Notices three boys crying and asks what is wrong with them, showing awareness and concern.
Sits on a dead soldier, appears blank and disconnected while others laugh at him.
Calls the crying boys over and leads them down the street, taking initiative to care for them.
Looks at others for answers and seems unsure about the battle location and situation.
Participates in the assault as the gates blow up and the unit storms in.
Attempts to hug the woman and child despite their fear, trying to show he is not a threat.
Grabs the women and pulls at their clothes after they scream and shrink away, showing anger and lack of respect for their fear.
Joins in breaking down doors and scavenging quickly with others, showing initiative and participation in the raid.
Mistakes strangers for his mother and sister, attempts to hug them despite their fear, showing poor judgment and lack of social awareness.
Tries to communicate that he is not a threat despite the women's fear, indicating some emotional intelligence and attempt at calming the situation.
Grabs and pulls at the women after they scream, escalating the situation and showing lack of control and understanding of consequences.
Pulls the little girl away from her mother to separate them forcibly.
Bites the little girl's wrist to break her grasp on her mother.
Shoots the mother in the head at point blank range.
Repeatedly denies the woman and girl as his family, showing emotional detachment.
Calmly asserts control over a chaotic and violent situation, pulling the girl away and stopping others from further harm.
Kills the mother decisively to prevent further chaos or distraction, showing cold, calculated decision-making.
Repeatedly insists the women are not his family, maintaining psychological control and emotional detachment.
Kills the Mother with a precise shot to the head at point blank range.
Sits grinding teeth in withdrawal, showing physical and mental endurance despite harsh conditions.
Observes the destruction and violence calmly, indicating situational awareness.
Watches the Commandant close a soldier's eyes tenderly but shows no sentimentality in his own eyes.
Looks up at the Commandant who smiles at him, indicating a moment of connection or recognition.
Watches the passing scenery attentively and looks up at the Commandant, showing awareness and engagement with his surroundings and leadership.
Shows no visible emotion during the Commandant's moment of sentimentality, indicating emotional control and focus.
Observes the town and notes that the people do not run despite the presence of armed forces, showing awareness and calmness.
Mentally speculates that the people might be spirits and calls the town 'death's hometown,' indicating a reflective and perceptive mindset.
Strains to take in all the new sites at Supreme Command Headquarters, showing some confusion and difficulty processing the environment.
Tugs on the shirts of two bodyguards who are lighting a joint, possibly trying to get their attention or interact.
Observes the Commandant's unhappiness and growing anger silently without intervening or warning others about suspicious behavior.
Notices the distant look on Commandant's face and contemplates the situation, wondering about the significance of people leaving their belongings behind and whether he should warn them.
Tugs on the shirts of bodyguards and smokes a joint, then collapses on the floor watching the clock passively.
Raises his rifle at the Armed Guard to demand water for his group.
Raises his rifle at the Armed Guard to demand water, successfully compelling the guard to bring water.
Observes the interaction between Commandant and Goodblood, noting that he has never seen anyone speak to Commandant in this way.
Watches Commandant leave with calculation, showing awareness and attentiveness.
Salutes excitedly when told he will accompany Commandant, showing eagerness but possibly lack of measured judgment.
Looks up in disbelief at the bootleg film, showing curiosity and openness to new experiences.
Asks the Madame for chips in a somewhat bossy manner despite being a child.
Looks up angrily when told there are no more girls for the little boys.
Attempts to assert control by ordering the Madame to bring chips, showing some confidence in a difficult environment.
Is dismissed by the Madame as a 'small thing borned yesterday' trying to order around, indicating a lack of respect and influence.
Remains behind alone after the men leave, sitting quietly and watching a movie, showing passivity and lack of initiative.
Reaches out to touch the young woman cleaning the table, but she reacts aggressively; Agu then leaves the room frustrated and bored.
Watches couples copulating and touches himself, showing detachment and self-focus.
Observes Two-I-C being dragged and in pain but does not intervene or show concern.
Studies the young woman carefully, observing details like her face, neck, and movements.
Reaches out to touch the woman but quickly withdraws when she reacts aggressively.
Leaves the room frustrated and bored instead of escalating the situation.
Watches couples copulating and touches himself, showing distraction and lack of focus.
Responds passively to the violent incident involving Two-I-C, not intervening or reacting decisively.
Shoots the girl and Madame on Commandant's order.
Sits next to Two-I-C, tending to him by squeezing a wet cloth on his forehead and whispering comforting words.
Grips his rifle and waits for the Commandant's order before shooting the girl and Madame.
Sits next to Two-I-C and carefully tends to him by squeezing a wet cloth over his forehead, showing attentiveness and care.
Whispers to Two-I-C to calm him by explaining that thinking causes pain, demonstrating emotional intelligence and presence of mind.
Reaches for Two-I-C's hand and holds it as he dies, feeling unsure but sad for him.
Does not respond to Commandant's invitation to sit and talk, remains distant.
Separates a bullet from its shell, empties gunpowder onto foil, lights it, scrapes residue, and sniffs it.
Approaches Two-I-C thinking he is dead, holds his hand, and shows emotional uncertainty.
Does not respond to Commandant's call and leans into the railing silently.
Feels uncertain about Commandant's occasional expressions of pity toward him.
Reflects on the slow death of Two-I-C with a somber, almost poetic tone.
Accepts the harsh realities of war and death without showing overt bitterness or cruelty.
Reports that Two-I-C is dead promptly and clearly.
Internalizes the situation with somber reflection, showing awareness of the gravity of war and death.
Does not challenge or question the Commandant's decisions or leadership despite changes and losses.
Holds Strika during the attack, showing physical comfort and solidarity.
Observes and reflects on the suffering of comrades (Hope and Tripod), showing empathy.
Collapses with Strika at bivouac, sharing exhaustion silently with others.
Starts to leave but notices Strika is immovable, implying concern or hesitation.
Holds onto Strika during the sudden attack, showing presence of mind and emotional support under fire.
Observes the wounded and dying comrades, showing awareness of the situation and its gravity.
Puts on his pack and prepares to move out when commanded, demonstrating readiness and discipline.
Reflects internally on the violence and chaos, expressing confusion and despair about their condition as 'wild animals'.
Insists that Strika move with the group despite Strika's injury, showing concern but urgency.
Picks up and carries injured Strika on his back despite the difficulty.
Shares half of a cricket with Strika, showing care and sharing limited resources.
Wants to express his own tiredness to Strika but holds back, showing empathy and emotional restraint.
Hears a song from his past and tries to share the moment with Strika, seeking comfort and connection.
Lays down dead Strika and cries, covers him with leaves.
Initially aims rifle at pregnant girl trying to escape, but lowers his aim when she tests him.
Briefly saddened by the girl's death but quickly returns to prying off dead man's boots.
Realizes Strika is dead, lays him down gently, and cries, showing emotional awareness but no immediate tactical response.
Covers Strika with leaves, showing respect and some presence of mind despite the situation.
Notices boots on a floating corpse, pries them off despite falling back into water, showing resourcefulness and determination.
Initially aims rifle at the pregnant girl trying to escape but lowers his aim when she tests him, showing cautious judgment and restraint.
Briefly saddened by the girl's death but quickly returns to prying off the boots, indicating emotional detachment or focus on survival over empathy.
Points out that a man is dead and takes his boots without hesitation.
Reflects on wanting to keep the mother's song in his pocket for himself, showing a desire for comfort and connection.
Wants to lie down on warm ground and feel the mud, expressing a longing for peace and simple natural comfort.
Points out that the man Preacher wants to shoot at is dead, preventing wasted ammo.
Boredly searches through abandoned rifles and dead bodies to find ammo, showing resourcefulness.
Walks through water-filled trench with rifle held above head to keep it dry, demonstrating practical battlefield awareness.
Appears distracted by internal thoughts and desires, such as wanting to lie down and feeling the wet ground, which may indicate moments of disengagement from immediate surroundings.
Reports to Commandant that they are out of bullets, showing dutifulness and honesty.
Does not respond when Commandant asks who is dead, indicating possible emotional withdrawal or confusion.
Reports to Commandant that they are out of bullets, showing awareness of their situation and duty.
Nods dutifully to Commandant's comment about the fog being their friend, indicating obedience but possibly lack of critical engagement.
Does not know how to answer Commandant's question about who is dead, showing uncertainty or confusion.
